TopicTitle: "Duna, Ore Bust!" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (COMPLETE)

Articles.Content:
I did throw heat shields on two of the crewed vessels going to Eve just in case (the third is a plane so it will hopefully be fine) There was probably a smarter way to do this, but I put the shields inside fairings to preserve them going to orbit and avoid drag.

Planes were what were most broken before and that's one of the things they tried to fix this time. Juries still out if that made any real difference.

Planes were what were most broken before and that's one of the things they tried to fix this time. Juries still out if that made any real difference.

Well, we're going to find out...

Well, we're going to find out...

http://i.imgur.com/4uKYVGU.png

The picture of Bill in that one would work great with a "Bring me the Child" caption.

Great work.
ROFL.... Kerbals aware of the changing physics. I laughed so had you had me in tears

ROFL.... Kerbals aware of the changing physics. I laughed so had you had me in tears

Laws of physics changed again?

...Must be the Tuesday.

"I felt... a great disturbance"

thats yoda talk

"I felt... a great disturbance"

thats yoda talk

Obi-Wan Kenobi actually.

Happy landings!

Here's hoping that the Hummlebee won't be affected too much by the 'disturbance'.

Edited June 26, 2015 by Starhawk

Well, we're going to find out...

I hope you brought enough fuel to stop at Eve without touching the atmosphere. I'm pretty much convinced the 1.0.4 system makes contact with significant atmospheres at interplanetary speeds well-nigh impossible. I expect further changes in the future to try to fix the problems introduced this time. So I'm just giving up on doing anything of substance in KSP for the time being.

I love Bill's reaction to the changes. Good luck with it and whatever happens, this thread will always be a classic.

Here's hoping that the Hummlebee won't be affected too much by the 'disturbance'.

Well...
Ooop.
Oh no, disaster! How will our intrepid kerbals get out of this predicament??
No, no, no!!!

Well shoot. I hope Bill pressed 'F5' before launch.

Edited June 26, 2015 by JonDahm
D*** profanity filter.
Oh-oh! How is that even possible? Glitch? Bug? Soupodynamics?
Come on Jeb, land this crate! You can do it!
Ohhh nonono! (me gets very nervous !)

Egad! What a mess. Zero lift on a symmetric wing, and probably the one that got put on first anyway due to default SPH camera position. Never seen that before.

And so, another cliffhanger...

They've got to have survived. Please please tell us they survived. They've come too far to let the wonky effects of an update end their adventure!

Although on a more technical note, there have been a lot of stories about existing craft going pear-shaped for one reason or another (usually heat, but now apparently aero as well) following the update.
The mk3 cockpit has 45m/s impact resistance, and their landing gear isn't retracted, so I think they will need a rescue mission, not a hearse mission.

Oh noooooo!

I have to say, I thought you were pretty brave, jumping into the 1.0.3/1.0.4 universe in mid-mission.

I so hope they all have -

Happy landings!

No, no, no!!!

Ohhhh yes. And here I was thinking, "everything's gotten so routine, how can I keep the comic interesting?"

Oh-oh! How is that even possible? Glitch? Bug? Soupodynamics?

I'm really not sure. Actually this is not a 1.0.3/4 thing, it happened once before in 1.0.2 when I switched the save between computers. I reverted that one and it fixed itself when I switched back so I kept it out of the comic. But seeing as we just had the scene where Bill noticed the 'disturbance', I thought I'd let it play out this time.

They've got to have survived. Please please tell us they survived. They've come too far to let the wonky effects of an update end their adventure!
Ohhh nonono! (me gets very nervous !)

I suppose this would be a bad time to announce that I'm going on vacation for the next two weeks?

I so hope they all have -

Happy landings!

Never have I appreciated your .sig so much Starhawk! All right, I don't actually leave until Tuesday, so here's the next two pages.
The care you take in picking facial expressions adds so much to the story.
Good so far, let's keep it coming after that vacation!

I thought for sure the old hummlebee would lose a wing there, Jeb defies fate again!

Also, is that a Kim Stanley Robinson reference I spy? Well done indeed sir, well done indeed.
Whew! Nice save
